property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Afghans and Americans greeting before being seated

note.text: In office settings, you will often be shown in by a subordinate. Your counterpart will probably greet you in front of their desk, where you'll chat before being invited to sit.

property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A service member meeting with an Afghan man

note.text: In villages, men will approach you upon your arrival, or will already be assembled. If you're wearing protective gear, and the situation is secure, remove your helmet and sunglasses to show good faith. If situationally possible, remove your gloves when greeting Afghans.

property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: U.S. service members meeting with Afghan women

note.text: If your mission includes interaction with local Afghan women, you'll likely need women on your team who can lead the engagement. Since Afghans in very remote areas may have never seen servicewomen, women on your team should remove equipment from their head and face so local counterparts can recognize them as women.
